title.narrative: Provision of temporary shelter and other essential basic supplies for vulnerable newly arrived UMNs in Teknaf and Ukhiya Upazilas of Cox’s Bazar district

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide emergency shelter assistance to 4,000 newly arrived undocumented Myanmar national (UMN) households staying in or adjacent to Kutupalong makeshift settlement, Leda makeshift settlement, and Shamlapur village (all in Cox's Bazar disctrict). IOM will use the CERF to provide shelter support and distribute essential basic NFIs, including cooking materials, clothing, mosquito nets and hygiene items to 4,000 UMN families (22,000 individuals). The project will be implemented over four months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
